overview_of_class:
Legal_St 333 "Constitutional Law II: Civil and Political Rights", Alisa Kaplan, Spring 2016 (combined with Poli_Sci 333)

This course investigates the civil rights and civil liberties protected by the Constitution and defined by the U.S.
Supreme Court. It will also examine the many controversies over what, exactly, the Constitution means, who
gets to decide, and how. We will discuss, among other topics, freedom of expression, freedom of religion,
privacy, equality, and criminal procedure.
name: Constitutional Law II
subject: LEGAL_ST
